newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia raises internal coffee price.
newsitem.headline: Colombia raises internal coffee price.

text.p: Colombia raised its internal coffee price to 235,500 pesos per 125-kilogram load early Wednesday in a bid to prevent protests against low domestic prices, Finance Minister Jose Antonio Ocanpo said.
The internal price, set by the National Coffee Growers Committee, had held at 201,500 pesos per 125-kg since February 16.

But the Growers Committee set it at 221,500 pesos after a long round of negotiations that began Tuesday evening -- with a premium of 14,000 pesos paid because of poor prospects for this year's harvest, set to begin in September.
Ocanpo, who sits on the Growers Committee, told reporters the premium would be paid at least until March of next year.

The increase was expected to prompt a rise in late registrations with the National Coffee Growers Federation for August shipment. But exporters and producers alike have said there is no sign that large amounts of coffee have been held back from the market in the hope of better prices.

Coffee producers have scheduled a protest march in central Aremina province for late Wednesday to protest against low internal prices and the recent appreciation of Colombia's peso cuurrency, which they say are driving the world's second top coffee-producing country out of the world market.
